intro: Otostemma, commonly known as the "false sandwort," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Montiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are small, herbaceous plants native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plants typically have succulent leaves and produce small, white or yellow flowers. Otostemma species are often found in rocky or sandy soils, and they exhibit adaptations to withstand drought conditions. Their botanical features make them interesting subjects for study in desert botany and ecological research.
